description: Golden fixture: Bio 101 - 5 question mini test
input: {"contract_version":"1.0","topic":"cell_biology","questions":[{"prompt":"What is the primary function of mitochondria?","choices":["Energy production through ATP synthesis","Protein synthesis","DNA replication","Waste removal"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse of the cell because they produce ATP through cellular respiration."},{"prompt":"Where is genetic material stored in eukaryotic cells?","choices":["Cytoplasm","Cell membrane","Nucleus","Endoplasmic reticulum"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"The nucleus is the membrane-bound organelle that contains the cell's chromosomes and genetic material (DNA)."},{"prompt":"What organelle is responsible for protein synthesis?","choices":["Golgi apparatus","Lysosome","Ribosome","Peroxisome"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"Ribosomes are the cellular structures that translate mRNA into polypeptide chains, synthesizing proteins."},{"prompt":"Which process allows cells to maintain internal balance?","choices":["Mitosis","Homeostasis","Photosynthesis","Fermentation"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"Homeostasis is the process by which cells and organisms maintain stable internal conditions despite external changes."},{"prompt":"What is the function of the cell membrane?","choices":["Energy storage","Protein production","Selective permeability and protection","Genetic information storage"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"The cell membrane controls what enters and leaves the cell through selective permeability while providing structural protection."}]}
notes: This is a golden fixture. It MUST pass all validators. Any changes require deliberate approval and review.
